item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:28, topic:375302”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=471256.msg3449570#msg3449570 date=1293653419]
I can’t stand temperatures above 25C. Especially in our climate, where high temperatures usually come with quite high humidity. But I agree with MITB. I love the diversity of seasons. I can stand low temperatures quite well, and aslong as I don’t have to ride my bike I actually enjoy cold hard winds.
[/quote]
Do yourself a favour and avoid Australia then. Our summer days can reach temperatures such as 45C (over 120F).[/quote]

Yea, I prefer going even more to the north.

Read full topic

item.description:

Do yourself a favour and avoid Australia then. Our summer days can reach temperatures such as 45C (over 120F).

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:26, topic:375302”]Here in England, we’re famous for never shutting up about the “shit” weather. But I have to say, I don’t mind it, I like that we never get the extremes of anything, no hurricanes, floods, blizzards, heat waves, etc. I have to say, I quite like the winter, not just for the snow but for the colder weather - it is easier to get warm than to stay cool.

Cold weather > Hot.[/quote]

This!

Cold weather is just ownage, I go to bed early just cos I like curling up and being warm. QUEER.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

I can’t stand temperatures above 25C. Especially in our climate, where high temperatures usually come with quite high humidity. But I agree with MITB. I love the diversity of seasons. I can stand low temperatures quite well, and aslong as I don’t have to ride my bike I actually enjoy cold hard winds.

Do yourself a favour and avoid Australia then. Our summer days can reach temperatures such as 45C (over 120F).

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Here in England, we’re famous for never shutting up about the “shit” weather. But I have to say, I don’t mind it, I like that we never get the extremes of anything, no hurricanes, floods, blizzards, heat waves, etc. I have to say, I quite like the winter, not just for the snow but for the colder weather - it is easier to get warm than to stay cool.

Cold weather > Hot.

Read full topic

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I curse the winter all the time, because it stops me from doing stuff like finishing up building my garage, working on cars and tractors and the like, and it makes me cold. But honestly, I don’t think I would like living anywhere without the change of seasons, here in Ohio I think we get the most diverse weather. Winter and Summer are pretty much the exact same length, and it gets as cold as about -15F sometimes, and as hot as 120F sometimes, and humidity all the way up to 90+% (which I could do without), and of course snow and the like. It’s a pain, but it’s life I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Lothy, snow was fine and dandy… Until it started getting in the way of responsibilities >.>

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

casey.:

It’d be better to have snow+cold, but just cold blows.

I agree, and Lothy sorry to hear. Snow is what makes winter / christmas in my opinion, I would hate to be without it

Read full topic

item.title: East Coast Blizzard
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:375302”][quote author=casey. link=topic=471256.msg3447506#msg3447506 date=1293523054]
0 inches in Florida.

Today was pretty cold though, mid around the low 40’s mid 30’s. It’d be better to have snow+cold, but just cold blows.
[/quote]

People in florida thinking 30s is cold makes me laugh. We haven’t seen 30s since mid-November, and even that is not much considering how cold it is further north of Ohio. There has also been snow on the ground for 3 weeks or so. :/[/quote]
30F is -1.1C – pretty damn cold from my point of view.

I know this is a real nuisance and pain in the arse for you guys, but I’d personally like to experience this at least once. I went to the snow when I was like 12 years old, and haven’t seen or touched any since. A ‘white christmas’ would be wonderful, albeit impossible down here in Australia.

Read full topic

[/quote]
